Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for IESE business school campus”
Reviews.Author: Rafa M
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from Barcelona and I stayed at Sansi Pedralbes. The hotel is quite modern and excellent located if you have to go to IESE's campus. It's approx. a 5 min walk to the campus!. The area where it's located it's great as it's one of the most exclusive and beautiful neighborhoods in BCN so you can enjoy watching amazing villas!. In terms of facilities, the hotel is quite well equiped with a spa, although I didn't have the chance to check it out :(. Finally, the staff is very nice and helpful although it doen't balances the size of the rooms, which are very small...

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel, close to IESE Business School”
Reviews.Author: Missulrik
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in a more residential area of Barcelona. Good if you are on a business trip - might be not suitable if you intend to visit on a city vacation, because then it is too far outside the center. Rooms are spacious and modern. I do not recommend the breakfast, though: coffee is good, but for 17 Euro I would really expect more. So better head for some coffee shop. Wake-up service was very reliable - you do not find this often in hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Rooms ok, great breakfast, nice area”
Reviews.Author: flora87
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near the business schools where lots of meetings are also held. Time to downtown with taxi is only about 15 minutes. However, as there are many schools around, make sure your avoid the "parents-traffic" in the morning. Rooms are ok, bathroom is very nice and breakfast very diverse and good. Staff is VERY friendly (at reception, bar, check-out).

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, as simple as that.!!”
Reviews.Author: Scottex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst at the IESE University on a business course, all of the front of house staff spoke better English than most people from the UK. The Hotel is elegant, bedrooms and public were spotless, the hotel was well appointed with everything you would expect from a 4* hotel, bar was well stocked with local and international brands available at more than reasonable prices, even free marshmallows and strawberry hearts in reception. Breakfast was excellent, a choice of continental and bacon & eggs,fresh fruit, cereals, fresh squeezed fruit juices and all types of coffees. Location, I agree it is not central, but if you done some research you would know that so why moan about it, for 9 euro you are in the heart of Barcelona, it would cost you more than that for a similar ride in London or Edinburgh. Would I stay here with my wife and family, without a shaddow of a doubt, do I want to be in central Barca and get no sleep, cause this city has lots of cars all day/night or in an elegant hotel where you can get sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not very central but quiet and great service”
Reviews.Author: Garzagul
Reviews.Content: In the university area, The Sansi Pedralbes hotel offers very nice rooms in a quite area that is very well connected to all parts of Barcelona. The ronda de Dalt ringway connects it rapidly to the airport. No restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Not good location to visit barcelona, surprises on the bill”
Reviews.Author: Rtestard
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a romantic week-end in barcelona. The hotel and rooms are alright but the location is not if you are planning on visiting the city. Far from the center and far from the metro.... I booked a double bedroom but have been given twin beds and bad surprise on checking out, they charged me 20 euros for the parking whereas they never mentioned any charge for it.... Impossible to argue with the receptionist, like talking to a wall.... So not very happy, would not recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: propmill
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel with very helpful English-speaking staff. The hotel is beautifully designed and rooms are very comfortable and quiet. Breakfasts rather let the hotel down. Located about 20 minutes' walk from the nearest metro station, but very convenient for the hop on hop off bus as the Pedralbes Monastery stop is very close. . I imagine the hotel is predominantly used for business as location is some way from the town centre, but we throughly enjoyed our stay. Barcelona itself is wonderful - try to get to a performance in the Palau de la Musica Catalana.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for business base, out of town location, close to business school”
Reviews.Author: Herts02
Reviews.Content: Room pleasant, comfortable bed. Breakfast average. Husband ordered room service which was disappointing to say the least - smoked salmon sandwich where the chef "forgot the smoked salmon", followed by a club sandwich minus the chicken.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here if you speak no spanish”
Reviews.Author: krissyjane
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, but the service is lacking if you don't speak any Spanish. Not one of the staff speaks a word of English. Consequently, we couldn't find out if the hotel has the facilities as stated on the website, reception was not aware if there is a gym/sauna, or if there is, where in the hotel it is... we couldn't get any room service, despite it supposedly being available all afternoon until 11pm. A very very disappointing experience, despite the lovely hotel building and room. I would think that a hotel that markets itself towards English speaking customers should make an effort to employ staff that have a basic understanding of the language.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet residential location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler64
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel while visiting the UPC campus which is very nearby. If you are visiting UPC, this hotel is in an outstanding location, <5 minute walk from campus. The lobby and rooms are modern and stylish. My room was not large, but it was very modern and nicely appointed. The bathroom was gorgeous. The room overall had everything I needed, including free wireless internet. The most remarkable thing about this hotel is the staff. They go out of their way to help. When I arrived, the checkin process took only moments, and almost as quickly they had brought a fresh cup of coffee to my room. At checkout, they had my luggage into a taxi for the airport within about a minute of me appearing in the lobby. They are clearly well-trained, and it was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnaMeeren
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel last may, and I was very surprised about the exellent service of the hotel staff. It is a small modern buisiness hotel. Apropriate rates and very well situated. My stay there was wonderfull and if I have return to Barcelona, I will be staying there again. I highly recommend this hotel to all frequent travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel out in suburbs”
Reviews.Author: denito_lopez
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for €75 per night / double room. Pretty good value. The rooms were modern and well appointed with effective air-con and the staff, who speak excellent English, were friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast, while of good quality, was pretty steep at €14 per person. The main thing about this hotel is that it is quite far out of town and, although the bus service is pretty good, the most frequent bus (No. 22) takes a good 30 minutes to get into the centre, while the nearest metro station a 20 minute walk away. One advantage is that Barcelona Bus Turistic, which brings you to all the major tourist attractions, stops at the nearby Monastir de Pedralbes. Taxi fare to the city-centre is about €8-11, depending on traffic. As noted in a previous review, however, the distance from the city-centre does mean that the hotel has nice views of the mountains. There's also a decent shopping centre on the Avinguda Diagonal near the metro station. Overall, we found the Sansi Pedralbes to be a decent base if a little too far from the city-centre; going back there every evening before heading back in to town for dinner, clubbing etc. was an hour-long round trip. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Barcelona, and we will be back.
